chainIssues: First narrator (Ali as immediate reporter) has uncertain reliability
Yahya ibn al-Yamani narrates with explicit hadathana (direct) term
Sufyan uses 'an from Yahya - ambiguous connection despite Sufyan's reliability
Jahdab al-Taymi is relatively weak (La Ba'sa Bihi) with 'an transmission
Ata' uses explicit sami'tu (heard) which strengthens connection from Jahdab
Transmission to companion Aisha is implied but not explicit
Multiple reliability gaps in middle of chain

potential_issues.issue: First narrator position ambiguous - Ali appears as 'qala lana' (said to us) rather than standard hadith narrator
potential_issues.impact: Unclear whether Ali is making the initial report or if there's another layer of transmission not explicitly stated

potential_issues.issue: Jahdab al-Taymi (La Ba'sa Bihi) narrates with 'an from Sufyan
potential_issues.impact: While not explicitly weak (daif), Jahdab's reliability is limited and 'an transmission creates ambiguity

potential_issues.issue: Multiple chains exist with confusing variants mentioned in editor notes
potential_issues.impact: Editor notes indicate uncertainty about relationship between variant chains, suggesting authentication difficulties

potential_issues.issue: Some alternative chains mentioned as problematic - Ibn Fudail chain involves unknown/weak narrators
potential_issues.impact: Presence of weak variant chains suggests core hadith also faces reliability questions

potential_issues.issue: This is mawquf (statement from companion Aisha) not marfu' (attributed to Prophet)
potential_issues.impact: Limits evidential value as it represents Aisha's opinion/knowledge, not necessarily prophetic guidance
